p: The repulsive effect of Z. leprieurii trunk bark, leaf and fruit essential oils and chemical insecticides were also evaluated by the McDonald method. The results ( Table 6) showed a high repulsive effect for the trunk bark essential oil (88.83%), followed by leaf essential oil (76.66%) and fruit essential oil (61.00%), in comparison with the low repulsive effect of the chemical insecticide Talisma UL (24.78%). Furthermore, repellent properties were doseâ€“response correlated and high when compared to other essential oils considered to be highly repulsive [ 78].
